Name: AF_DATA_REQUEST
Description: This command is used by the tester to build and send a message through AF layer.

Name: DATA_STORE
Description: Huge AF data request data buffer store command and data.

Name: DATA_RETRIEVE
Description: Huge AF incoming message data buffer retrieve command.

Name: AF_APSF_CONFIG_SET
Description: MT proxy for afAPSF_ConfigSet().

Name: AF_REFLECT_ERROR
Description: This command is sent by the device to the user when it determines that an error occurred during areflected message.

Name: AF_INCOMING_MSG
Description: This callback message is in response to incoming data to any of the registered endpoints on thisdevice.

Name: APP_MSG
Description: This command is sent to the target in order to test the functions defined for individual applications.This command sends a raw data to an application.

Name: APP_USER_TEST
Description: This command is used by tester to issue user’s defined commands to the application.

Name: DEBUG_SET_THRESHOLD
Description: This command allows the user to set the threshold for the debug message.

Name: DEBUG_MSG
Description: This command sends a debug string to Z-Tool. The content of the string is defined by theapplication.

Name: MAC_RESET_REQ
Description: This command is used to send a MAC Reset command to reset MAC state machine.

Name: MAC_INIT
Description: This command is used to initialize the MAC.

Name: MAC_SYNC_REQ
Description: This command is used to request synchronization to the current network beacon

Name: MAC_DATA_REQ
Description: This command is used to send (on behalf of the next higher layer) MAC Data Frame packet.

Name: MAC_ASSOCIATE_REQ
Description: This command is used to request (on behalf of the next higher layer) an association with acoordinator

Name: MAC_ASSOCIATE_RSP
Description: This command is sent by the host to response to the MAC_ASSOCIATE_IND.

Name: MAC_DISASSOCIATE_REQ
Description: This command is used to request (on behalf of the next higher layer) a disassociation of the devicefrom the coordinator.

Name: MAC_GET_REQ
Description: This command is used to read (on behalf of the next higher layer) a MAC PIB attribute.

Name: MAC_SET_REQ
Description: This command is used to request the device to write a MAC PIB value.

Name: MAC_SCAN_REQ
Description: This command is used to send a request to the device to perform a network scan.

Name: MAC_ORPHAN_RSP
Description: This command is sent by the host to response to the ORPHAN_IND.

Name: MAC_SET_RX_GAIN_REQ
Description: This command is used to send a request to the device to set Rx gain.

Name: MAC_ASSOCIATE_IND
Description: This callback is called by the MAC to send (on behalf of the next higher layer) an associationindication message.

Name: MAC_ASSOCIATE_CNF
Description: This callback is called by the MAC to send (on behalf of the next higher layer) an associationconfirmation message.

Name: MAC_BEACON_NOTIFY_IND
Description: This callback is called by the MAC to send (on behalf of the next higher layer) a MAC beaconnotify indication.

Name: MAC_DATA_CNF
Description: This callback is called by the MAC to send (on behalf of the next higher layer) a MAC dataconfirmation.

Name: MAC_DISASSOCIATE_CNF
Description: This callback is called by the MAC to send (on behalf of the next higher layer) a MACdisassociate confirm.

Name: MAC_ORPHAN_IND
Description: This callback is called by the MAC to send (on behalf of the next higher layer) a MAC orphanindication.

Name: MAC_POLL_CNF
Description: This callback is called by the MAC to send (on behalf of the next higher layer) a MAC pollconfirmation.

Name: MAC_SCAN_CNF
Description: This callback is called by the MAC to send (on behalf of the next higher layer) a MAC scanconfirmation.

Name: MAC_COMM_STATUS_IND
Description: This callback is called by the MAC to send (on behalf of the next higher layer) a MACcommunication indicator.

Name: MAC_START_CNF
Description: This callback is called by the MAC to send (on behalf of the next higher layer) a MAC startconfirmation.

Name: MAC_RX_ENABLE_CNF
Description: This callback is called by the MAC to send (on behalf of the next higher layer) a MAC Rx enableconfirmation.

Name: MAC_PURGE_CNF
Description: This callback is called by the MAC to send (on behalf of the next higher layer) a MAC purgeconfirmation.

Name: ZB_SYSTEM_RESET
Description: This command will reset the device by using a soft reset (i.e. a jump to the reset vector) vice ahardware reset (i.e. watchdog reset.) This is especially useful in the CC2531, for instance, so thatthe USB host does not have to contend with the USB H/W resetting (and thus causing the USBhost to re-enumerate the device which can cause an open virtual serial port to hang.)

Name: ZB_START_REQUEST
Description: This command starts the ZigBee stack. When the ZigBee stack starts, the device reads configuration parameters from nonvolatile memory and the device joins its network. The ZigBee stack calls the zb_StartConfirm callback function when the startup process completes. After the start request process completes, the device is ready to send, receive, and route network traffic

Name: ZB_PERMIT_JOINING_REQUEST
Description: This command is used to control the joining permissions and thus allows or disallows new devicesfrom joining the network.

Name: ZB_ALLOW_BIND
Description: This command puts the device into the Allow Binding Mode for a given period of time.  A peerdevice can establish a binding to a device in the Allow Binding Mode by calling zb_BindDevicewith a destination address of NULL.

Name: ZB_SEND_DATA_REQUEST
Description: This command initiates transmission of data to a peer device.

Name: ZB_READ_CONFIGURATION
Description: This command is used to get a configuration property from non-volatile memory.

Name: ZB_WRITE_CONFIGURATION
Description: This command is used to write a Configuration Property to non-volatile memory.

Name: ZB_GET_DEVICE_INFO
Description: This command retrieves a Device Information Property.

Name: ZB_START_CONFIRM
Description: This callback is called by the ZigBee stack after a start request operation completes.

Name: ZB_BIND_CONFIRM
Description: This callback is called by the ZigBee stack after a bind operation completes.

Name: ZB_ALLOW_BIND_CONFIRM
Description: This callback indicates another device attempted to bind to this device.

Name: ZB_RECEIVE_DATA_INDICATION
Description: This callback is called asynchronously by the ZigBee stack to notify the application when data isreceived from a peer device.

Name: ZB_FIND_DEVICE_CONFIRM
Description: This callback is called by the ZigBee stack when a find device operation completes. SearchType = 0x01

Name: SYS_RESET_REQ
Description: This command is sent by the tester to reset the target device

Name: SYS_PING
Description: This command issues PING requests to verify if a device is active and check the capability of thedevice.

Name: SYS_VERSION
Description: This command is used to request for the device’s version string.

Name: SYS_SET_EXTADDR
Description: This command is used to set the extended address of the device.

Name: SYS_GET_EXTADDR
Description: This command is used to get the extended address of the device.

Name: SYS_RAM_READ
Description: This command is used by the tester to read a single memory location in the target RAM. Thecommand accepts an address value and returns the memory value present in the target RAM at thataddress.

Name: SYS_RAM_WRITE
Description: This command is used by the tester to write to a particular location in the target RAM. Thecommand accepts an address location and a memory value. The memory value is written to theaddress location in the target RAM.

Name: SYS_OSAL_NV_READ
Description: This command is used by the tester to read a single memory item from the target non-volatilememory. The command accepts an attribute Id value and data offset and returns the memory valuepresent in the target for the specified attribute Id.

Name: SYS_OSAL_NV_WRITE
Description: This command is used by the tester to write to a particular item in non-volatile memory. Thecommand accepts an attribute Id, data offset, data length, and attribute value. The attribute value iswritten to the location specified for the attribute Id in the target.

Name: SYS_OSAL_START_TIMER
Description: This command is used by the tester to start a timer event. The event will expired after the indicatedamount of time and a notification will be sent back to the tester.UsageSREQ:11112Length = 0x03Cmd0 = 0x21Cmd1 = 0x0AIdTimeoutAttributes:AttributeLength (byte)DescriptionId1The Id of the timer event (0-3)Timeout2Amount of time it will take before the event expired in milliseconds.SRSP:1111Length = 0x01Cmd0 = 0x61Cmd1 = 0x0AStatusAttributes:AttributeLength (byte)DescriptionStatus1Status is either Success (0) or Failure (1).3.8.1.14SYS_OSAL_STOP_TIMERDescription:This command is used by the tester to stop a timer event.

Name: SYS_RANDOM
Description: This command is used by the tester to get a random 16-bit number.

Name: SYS_SET_TX_POWER
Description: This command is used by the tester to set the target system radio transmit power. The returned TXpower is the actual setting applied to the radio – nearest characterized value for the specific radio.

Name: SYS_ZDIAGS_CLEAR_STATS
Description: This command is used to clear the statistics table. To clear data in NV (including the BootCounter) the clearNV flag shall be set to TRUE.

Name: SYS_ZDIAGS_GET_STATS
Description: This command is used to read a specific system (attribute) ID statistics and/or metrics value.

Name: SYS_ZDIAGS_RESTORE_STATS_NV
Description: This command is used to restore the statistics table from NV into the RAM table.

Name: SYS_ZDIAGS_SAVE_STATS_TO_NV
Description: This command is used to save the statistics table from RAM to NV.

Name: SYS_NV_CREATE
Description: This command is used to attempt to create an item in non-volatile memory.

Name: SYS_NV_DELETE
Description: This command is used to attempt to delete an item in non-volatile memory.

Name: SYS_NV_LENGTH
Description: This command is used to get the length of an item in non-volatile memory.

Name: SYS_NV_READ
Description: This command is used to read an item in non-volatile memory.

Name: SYS_NV_WRITE
Description: This command is used to write an item in non-volatile memory

Name: SYS_NV_UPDATE
Description: This command is used to update an item in non-volatile memory

Name: SYS_NV_COMPACT
Description: This command is used to compact the active page in non-volatile memory

Name: SYS_OSAL_NV_READ_EXT
Description: This command is used by the tester to read a single memory item from the target non-volatilememory. The command accepts an attribute Id value and data offset and returns the memory valuepresent in the target for the specified attribute Id.

Name: SYS_OSAL_NV_WRITE_EXT
Description: This command is used by the tester to write to a particular item in non-volatile memory. Thecommand accepts an attribute Id, data offset, data length, and attribute value. The attribute value iswritten to the location specified for the attribute Id in the target.

Name: SYS_RESET_IND
Description: This callback is sent by the device to indicate that a reset has occurred.

Name: SYS_OSAL_TIMER_EXPIRED
Description: This callback is sent by the device to indicate that a specific timer has been expired.

Name: UTIL_GET_DEVICE_INFO
Description: This command is sent by the tester to retrieve the device info.

Name: UTIL_GET_NV_INFO
Description: This command is used by the tester to read a block of parameters from non-volatile storage of thetarget device.

Name: UTIL_SET_CHANNELS
Description: This command is used to store a channel select bit-mask into non-volatile memory to be used thenext time the target device resets.

Name: UTIL_SET_SECLEVEL
Description: This command is used to store a security level value into non-volatile memory to be used the next time the target deviceresets.

Name: UTIL_SET_PRECFGKEY
Description: This command is used to store a pre-configured key array into non-volatile memory to be used thenext time the target device resets.

Name: UTIL_KEY_EVENT
Description: Sends key and shift codes to the application that registered for key events. The keys parameter is abit mask, allowing for multiple keys in a single command. The return status indicates success ifthe command is processed by a registered key handler, not whether the key code was used. Not allapplications support all key or shift codes but there is no indication when a key code is dropped.

Name: UTIL_TIME_ALIVE
Description: This command is used by the tester to get the board’s time alive.

Name: UTIL_LED_CONTROL
Description: This command is used by the tester to control the LEDs on the board.

Name: UTIL_DATA_REQ
Description: This command is used by the tester to effect a MAC MLME Poll Request.

Name: UTIL_SRC_MATCH_ADD_ENTRY
Description: This command is used to add a short or extended address to the source address table.

Name: UTIL_SRC_MATCH_DEL_ENTRY
Description: This command is used to delete a short or extended address from the source address table.

Name: UTIL_SRC_MATCH_CHECK_SRC_ADDR
Description: This command is used to check if a short or extended address is in the source address table.

Name: UTIL_SRC_MATCH_ACK_ALL_PENDING
Description: This command is used to enable/disable acknowledging all packets with pending bit set.

Name: UTIL_SRC_MATCH_CHECK_ALL_PENDING
Description: This command is used to check if acknowledging all packets with pending bit set is enabled.

Name: UTIL_ADDRMGR_EXT_ADDR_LOOKUP
Description: This command is a proxy call to the AddrMgrEntryLookupExt() function.

Name: UTIL_APSME_LINK_KEY_DATA_GET
Description: This command retrieves APS link key data, Tx and Rx frame counters.

Name: UTIL_APSME_LINK_KEY_NV_ID_GET
Description: This command is a proxy call to the APSME_LinkKeyNvIdGet() function.

Name: UTIL_APSME_REQUEST_KEY_CMD
Description: This command is used to send a request key to the Trust Center from an originator device whowants to exchange messages with a partner device.

Name: UTIL_ASSOC_COUNT
Description: This command is a proxy call to the AssocCount() function.

Name: UTIL_ASSOC_FIND_DEVICE
Description: This command is a proxy call to the AssocFindDevice() function.

Name: UTIL_ASSOC_GET_WITH_ADDRESS
Description: This command is a proxy call to the AssocGetWithAddress() function.

Name: UTIL_BIND_ADD_ENTRY
Description: This command is a proxy call to the bindAddEntry() function.

Name: UTIL_ZCL_KEY_EST_INIT_EST
Description: This command is a proxy call to zclGeneral_KeyEstablish_InitiateKeyEstablishment().

Name: UTIL_ZCL_KEY_EST_SIGN
Description: This command is a proxy call to zclGeneral_KeyEstablishment_ECDSASign().

Name: UTIL_SYNC_REQ
Description: This is an asynchronous request/response handshake.

Name: ZDO_NWK_ADDR_REQ
Description: This message will request the device to send a “Network Address Request”.  This message sends abroadcast message looking for a 16 bit address with a known 64 bit IEEE address.  You mustsubscribe to “ZDO Network Address Response” to receive the response to this message. Checksection 3.0.1.7 for more details on callback subscription. The response message listed below onlyindicates whether or not the message was received properly.

Name: ZDO_IEEE_ADDR_REQ
Description: This command will request a device’s IEEE 64-bit address.  You must subscribe to “ZDO IEEEAddress Response” to receive the data response to this message.  The response message listedbelow only indicates whether or not the message was received properly.

Name: ZDO_SIMPLE_DESC_REQ
Description: This command is generated to inquire as to the Simple Descriptor of the destination device’sEndpoint.

Name: ZDO_ACTIVE_EP_REQ
Description: This command is generated to request a list of active endpoint from the destination device.

Name: ZDO_MATCH_DESC_REQ
Description: This command is generated to request the device match descriptor.

Name: ZDO_COMPLEX_DESC_REQ
Description: This command is generated to request for the destination device’s complex descriptor.

Name: ZDO_USER_DESC_REQ
Description: This command is generated to request for the destination device’s user descriptor.

Name: ZDO_END_DEVICE_ANNCE
Description: This command will cause the device to issue an “End device announce” broadcast packet to thenetwork. This is typically used by an end-device to announce itself to the network.

Name: ZDO_USER_DESC_SET
Description: This command is generated to write a User Descriptor value to the targeted device.

Name: ZDO_SERVER_DISC_REQ
Description: The command is used for local device to discover the location of a particular system server orservers as indicated by the ServerMask parameter. The destination addressing on this request is‘broadcast to all RxOnWhenIdle devices’.

Name: ZDO_END_DEVICE_BIND_REQ
Description: This command is generated to request an End Device Bind with the destination device.

Name: ZDO_BIND_REQ
Description: This command is generated to request a Bind.

Name: ZDO_UNBIND_REQ
Description: This command is generated to request a un-bind.

Name: ZDO_MGMT_NWK_DISC_REQ
Description: This command is generated to request the destination device to perform a network discovery.

Name: ZDO_MGMT_LQI_REQ
Description: This command is generated to request the destination device to perform a LQI query of otherdevices in the network.

Name: ZDO_MGMT_RTG_REQ
Description: This command is generated to request the Routing Table of the destination device.

Name: ZDO_MGMT_BIND_REQ
Description: This command is generated to request the Binding Table of the destination device.UsageSREQ:Byte: 11121Length = 0x03Cmd0 = 0x25Cmd1 = 0x33DstAddrStartIndexAttributes:AttributeLength (byte)DescriptionDstAddr2Specifies the network address of the device being queried.StartIndex1Specifies where to start in the response array list.  The result may contain more entriesthan can be reported, so this field allows the user to retrieve the responses anywhere inthe array list.SRSP:1111Length = 0x01Cmd0 = 0x65Cmd1 = 0x33StatusAttributes:AttributeLength (byte)DescriptionStatus1Status is either Success (0) or Failure (1).3.12.1.20 ZDO_MGMT_LEAVE_REQDescription:This command is generated to request a Management Leave Request for the target device.

Name: ZDO_MGMT_DIRECT_JOIN_REQ
Description: This command is generated to request the Management Direct Join Request of a designateddevice.

Name: ZDO_MGMT_PERMIT_JOIN_REQ
Description: This command is generated to set the Permit Join for the destination device.

Name: ZDO_MGMT_NWK_UPDATE_REQ
Description: This command is provided to allow updating of network configuration parameters or to requestinformation from devices on network conditions in the local operating environment.

Name: ZDO_MSG_CB_REGISTER
Description: This command registers for a ZDO callback (see reference [3], “6. ZDO Message Requests” forexample usage).

Name: ZDO_MSG_CB_REMOVE
Description: This command removes a registration for a ZDO callback (see reference [3], “6. ZDO MessageRequests” for example usage).

Name: ZDO_STARTUP_FROM_APP
Description: This command starts the device in the network.

Name: ZDO_STARTUP_FROM_APP_EX
Description: Extended version of ZDO to indicate to router devices to create a distributed network.

Name: ZDO_SET_LINK_KEY
Description: This command sets the application link key for a given device.

Name: ZDO_REMOVE_LINK_KEY
Description: This command removes the application link key of a given device.

Name: ZDO_GET_LINK_KEY
Description: This command retrieves the application link key of a given device.

Name: ZDO_NWK_DISCOVERY_REQ
Description: This command is used to initiate a network discovery (active scan).

Name: ZDO_JOIN_REQ
Description: This command is used to request the device to join itself to a parent device on a network.

Name: ZDO_SET_REJOIN_PARAMETERS
Description: This command is used to set rejoin backoff duration and rejoin scan duration for an end device

Name: ZDO_SEC_ENTRY_LOOKUP_EXT
Description: This command handles the ZDO security entry lookup extended extension message.

Name: ZDO_SEC_DEVICE_REMOVE
Description: This command handles the ZDO security remove device extended extension message.

Name: ZDO_EXT_ROUTE_DISC
Description: This command handles the ZDO route discovery extension message.

Name: ZDO_EXT_ROUTE_CHECK
Description: This command handles the ZDO route check extension message.

Name: ZDO_EXT_REMOVE_GROUP
Description: This command handles the ZDO extended remove group extension message.

Name: ZDO_END_DEVICE_ANNCE_IND
Description: This callback indicates the ZDO End Device Announce

Name: ZDO_EXT_REMOVE_ALL_GROUP
Description: This command handles the ZDO extended remove all group extension message.

Name: ZDO_EXT_FIND_ALL_GROUPS_ENDPOINT
Description: This command handles the ZDO extension find all groups for endpoint message

Name: ZDO_EXT_FIND_GROUP
Description: This command handles the ZDO extension find group message

Name: ZDO_EXT_ADD_GROUP
Description: This command handles the ZDO extension add group message.

Name: ZDO_EXT_COUNT_ALL_GROUPS
Description: This command handles the ZDO extension count all groups message.

Name: ZDO_EXT_RX_IDLE
Description: This command handles the ZDO extension Get/Set RxOnIdle to ZMac message

Name: ZDO_EXT_UPDATE_NWK_KEY
Description: This command handles the ZDO security update network key extension message.

Name: ZDO_EXT_SWITCH_NWK_KEY
Description: This command handles the ZDO security switch network key extension message.

Name: ZDO_EXT_SEC_APS_REMOVE_REQ
Description: This command handles the ZDO extension Security Manager APS Remove Request message.

Name: ZDO_FORCE_CONCENTRATOR_CHANGE
Description: This command forces a network concentrator change by resetting   zgConcentratorEnable andzgConcentratorDiscoveryTime from NV and set nwk event.

Name: ZDO_EXT_SET_PARAMS
Description: This command set parameters not settable through NV.

Name: ZDO_NODE_DESC_RSP
Description: This callback message is in response to the ZDO Node Descriptor Request.

Name: ZDO_POWER_DESC_RSP
Description: This callback message is in response to the ZDO Power Descriptor Request.

Name: ZDO_ACTIVE_EP_RSP
Description: This callback message is in response to the ZDO Active Endpoint Request.

Name: ZDO_COMPLEX_DESC_RSP
Description: This callback message is in response to the ZDO Complex Descriptor Request.

Name: ZDO_USER_DESC_RSP
Description: This callback message is in response to the ZDO User Descriptor Request.

Name: ZDO_USER_DESC_CONF
Description: This confirmation notifies the user when the device receives a user descriptor.

Name: ZDO_SERVER_DISC_RSP
Description: This callback message is in response to the ZDO System Service Discovery Request. Uponreceiving the request, remote devices shall compare the ServerMask parameter to the Server Maskfield in their own Node descriptor. If no bits are found to match, no action is taken.

Name: ZDO_BIND_RSP
Description: This callback message is in response to the ZDO Bind Request.

Name: ZDO_UNBIND_RSP
Description: This callback message is in response to the ZDO Unbind Request.

Name: ZDO_MGMT_LQI_RSP
Description: This callback message is in response to the ZDO Management LQI Request.

Name: ZDO_MGMT_RTG_RSP
Description: This callback message is in response to the ZDO Management Routing Table Request.

Name: ZDO_MGMT_BIND_RSP
Description: This callback message is in response to the ZDO Management Binding Table Request.

Name: ZDO_MGMT_LEAVE_RSP
Description: This callback message is in response to the ZDO Management Leave Request.

Name: ZDO_MGMT_DIRECT_JOIN_RSP
Description: This callback message is in response to the ZDO Management Direct Join Request.

Name: ZDO_MGMT_PERMIT_JOIN_RSP
Description: This callback message is in response to the ZDO Management Permit Join Request.

Name: ZDO_STATE_CHANGE_IND
Description: This callback message indicates the ZDO state change.

Name: ZDO_MATCH_DESC_RSP_SENT
Description: This callback indicates that Match Descriptor Response has been sent.

Name: ZDO_STATUS_ERROR_RSP
Description: This message is the default message for error status.

Name: ZDO_SRC_RTG_IND
Description: This message is an indication to inform host device the receipt of a source route to a given device.

Name: ZDO_BEACON_NOTIFY_IND
Description: This message is an indication to inform host device the receipt of a beacon notification.

Name: ZDO_JOIN_CNF
Description: This message is an indication to inform host device the result of a ZDO join request.

Name: ZDO_NWK_DISCOVERY_CNF
Description: This message is an indication to inform host device the completion of network discovery scan.

Name: ZDO_LEAVE_IND
Description: This message is an indication to inform the host of a device leaving the network.

Name: ZDO_MSG_CB_INCOMING
Description: This message is a ZDO callback for a Cluster Id that the host requested to receive with a ZDO_MSG_CB_REGISTER request.

Name: ZDO_PERMIT_JOIN_IND
Description: This message is a ZDO callback for Permit Join Indication.

Name: APP_CNF_SET_DEFAULT_REMOTE_ENDDEVICE_TIMEOUT
Description: _TIMEOUTDescription:Sets the default value used by parent device to expire legacy child devices.Usage:

Name: APP_CNF_SET_ALLOWREJOIN_TC_POLICY
Description: Sets the AllowRejoin TC policy.

Name: APP_CNF_BDB_START_COMMISSIONING
Description: Set the commissioning methods to be executed. Initialization of BDB is executed with this call,regardless of its parameters.

Name: APP_CNF_BDB_SET_CHANNEL
Description: Sets BDB primary or secondary channel masks.

Name: APP_CNF_BDB_ADD_INSTALLCODE
Description: Add a preconfigured key (plain key or IC) to Trust Center device.

Name: APP_CNF_BDB_SET_JOINUSESINSTALLCODEKEY
Description: Sets the policy to mandate or not the usage of an Install Code upon joining.

Name: APP_CNF_BDB_SET_ACTIVE_DEFAULT_CENTRALIZED_KEY
Description: EYDescription:On joining devices, set the default key or an install code to attempt to join the network.Usage:

Name: APP_CNF_BDB_COMMISSIONING_NOTIFICATION
Description: Callback to receive notifications from BDB process.

Name: GP_DATA_REQ
Description: Callback to receive notifications from BDB process.

Name: GP_SEC_RSP
Description: This message provides a mechanism for the Green Power EndPoint to provide security data intothe dGP stub.

Name: GP_SEC_REQ
Description: This message provides a mechanism for dGP stub to request security data from the Green PowerEndPoint in the host processor.

Name: GP_DATA_IND
Description: This message provides a mechanism for identifying and conveying a received GPDF to the GreenPower EndPoint in the host processor.
